Etc¶

Metrics¶

class kospeech.metrics.CharacterErrorRate(id2char, eos_id)[source]¶

Computes the Character Error Rate, defined as the edit distance between the two provided sentences after tokenizing to characters.

metric(s1, s2)[source]¶

Computes the Character Error Rate, defined as the edit distance between the two provided sentences after tokenizing to characters.

Parameters:
  • s1 (string) – space-separated sentence
  • s2 (string) – space-separated sentence
class kospeech.metrics.ErrorRate(id2char, eos_id)[source]¶

Provides inteface of error rate calcuation.

Note

Do not use this class directly, use one of the sub classes.

class kospeech.metrics.WordErrorRate(id2char, eos_id)[source]¶

Computes the Word Error Rate, defined as the edit distance between the two provided sentences after tokenizing to words.

metric(s1, s2)[source]¶

Computes the Word Error Rate, defined as the edit distance between the two provided sentences after tokenizing to words.

Parameters:
  • s1 (string) – space-separated sentence
  • s2 (string) – space-separated sentence

inference options

kospeech.opts.build_model_opts(parser)[source]¶

These options are passed to the construction of the model. Be careful with these as they will be used during inference.

Utils¶

class kospeech.utils.Logger[source]¶

Print log message in format. FORMAT: [%(asctime)s %(filename)s:%(lineno)s - %(funcName)s()] %(message)s

debug(message='')[source]¶

Print log message for debugging

info(message='')[source]¶

Print log message for information

kospeech.utils.check_envirionment(use_cuda)[source]¶

Check execution envirionment. OS, Processor, CUDA version, Pytorch version, … etc.

kospeech.utils.label_to_string(labels, id2char, eos_id)[source]¶

Converts label to string (number => Hangeul)

Parameters:
  • labels (numpy.ndarray) – number label
  • id2char (dict) – id2char[id] = ch
  • eos_id (int) – identification of <end of sequence>
Returns: sentence
  • sentence (str or list): symbol of labels
